body_html:
after debating probably for like more than a month, going back and forth a hundred times, @colesbury vetoed this. So bringing closure to the PR and issue.

His view is that if you want to modify the Sequential, it should be converted to a list, the list be filtered and the Sequential re-constructed, instead of pretending to semi-mutate the module with some methods. And the API change to add_module was voted out (i.e. name becoming a kwarg) for many reasons, backward-compat being one.

body:
after debating probably for like more than a month, going back and forth a hundred times, @colesbury vetoed this. So bringing closure to the PR and issue.

His view is that if you want to modify the Sequential, it should be converted to a list, the list be filtered and the Sequential re-constructed, instead of pretending to semi-mutate the module with some methods. And the API change to `add_module` was voted out (i.e. name becoming a kwarg) for many reasons, backward-compat being one.
